definitions.definition: The steep side of a mountain etc.; a slope or acclivity.
Of a near-vertical gradient; of a slope, surface, curve, etc. that proceeds upward at an angle near vertical.
definitions.example: a steep hill or mountain; a steep roof; a steep ascent; a steep barometric gradient
Twenty quid for a shave? That's a bit steep.

definitions.definition: Difficult to access; not easy reached; lofty; elevated; high.
(of the rake of a ship's mast, or a car's windshield) resulting in a mast or windshield angle that strongly diverges from the perpendicular
definitions.example: The steep rake of the windshield enhances the fast lines of the exterior. http//legacy.sandiegouniontribune.com/uniontrib/20070303/news_lz1dd3maynard.html

definitions.definition: A liquid used in a steeping process
definitions.example: Corn steep has many industrial uses.

definitions.definition: (middle voice) To soak or wet thoroughly.
To imbue with something; to be deeply immersed in.
definitions.example: The learned of the nation were steeped in Latin.
